data.name: Project
data.value: An MSBuild project.

data.name: Project.DefaultTargets
data.value: Optional semi-colon separated list of one or more targets that will be built if no targets are otherwise specified

data.name: Project.InitialTargets
data.value: Optional semi-colon separated list of targets that should always be built before any other targets

data.name: Project.Sdk
data.value: Optional string describing the MSBuild SDK(s) this project should be built with

data.name: Project.ToolsVersion
data.value: Optional string describing the toolset version this project should normally be built with

data.name: Project.TreatAsLocalProperty
data.value: Command-line properties to ignore in this file and its imports.

data.name: Project.xmlns
data.value: XML namespace, must be "http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003".

data.name: Target
data.value: Groups tasks into a section of the build process

data.name: Target.Name
data.value: Name of the target

data.name: Target.DependsOnTargets
data.value: Optional semi-colon separated list of targets that should be run before this target

data.name: Target.Inputs
data.value: Optional semi-colon separated list of files that form inputs into this target. Their timestamps will be compared with the timestamps of files in Outputs to determine whether the Target is up to date

data.name: Target.Outputs
data.value: Optional semi-colon separated list of files that form outputs into this target. Their timestamps will be compared with the timestamps of files in Inputs to determine whether the Target is up to date

data.name: Target.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the Target and the targets it depends on should be run

data.name: Target.KeepDuplicateOutputs
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether duplicate items in the Target's Returns should be removed before returning them. The default is not to eliminate duplicates.

data.name: Target.Returns
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine which items generated by the target should be returned by the target. If there are no Returns attributes on Targets in the file, the Outputs attributes are used instead for this purpose.

data.name: Target.BeforeTargets
data.value: Optional semi-colon separated list of targets that this target should run before.

data.name: Target.AfterTargets
data.value: Optional semi-colon separated list of targets that this target should run before.

data.name: Target.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements.

data.name: ProjectExtensions
data.value: Optional section used by MSBuild hosts, that may contain arbitrary XML content that is ignored by MSBuild itself.

data.name: Item.Include
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of files (wildcards are allowed) or other item names to include in this item list

data.name: Item.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the items should be evaluated

data.name: Item.Exclude
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of files (wildcards are allowed) or other item names to exclude from the Include list

data.name: Item.Remove
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of files (wildcards are allowed) or other item names to remove from the existing list contents

data.name: Item.Update
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of files (wildcards are allowed) or other item names to be updated with the metadata from contained in this xml element

data.name: Item.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: Item.Include.Parameterized
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of {0} (wildcards are allowed) or other item names to include in this item list

data.name: Item.Exclude.Parameterized
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of {0} (wildcards are allowed) or other item names to exclude from the Include list

data.name: Item.Remove.Parameterized
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of {0} (wildcards are allowed) or other item names to remove from the existing list contents

data.name: Item.Update.Parameterized
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of {0} (wildcards are allowed) or other item names to be updated with the metadata from contained in this xml element

data.name: Property.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: Property.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the property should be evaluated

data.name: PropertyGroup
data.value: Groups property definitions

data.name: PropertyGroup.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the PropertyGroup should be used

data.name: PropertyGroup.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: ImportGroup
data.value: Groups import definitions

data.name: ImportGroup.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the ImportGroup should be used

data.name: ImportGroup.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: ItemGroup
data.value: Groups item definitions

data.name: ItemGroup.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the ItemGroup should be used

data.name: ItemGroup.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: ItemDefinitionGroup
data.value: Groups item metadata definitions

data.name: ItemDefinitionGroup.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the ItemDefinitionGroup should be used

data.name: ItemDefinitionGroup.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: Choose
data.value: Groups When and Otherwise elements

data.name: Choose.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: When
data.value: Groups PropertyGroup and/or ItemGroup elements

data.name: When.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the child PropertyGroups and/or ItemGroups should be used

data.name: Otherwise
data.value: Groups PropertyGroup and/or ItemGroup elements that are used if no Conditions on sibling When elements evaluate to true

data.name: OnError
data.value: Specifies targets to execute in the event of a recoverable error

data.name: OnError.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the targets should be executed

data.name: OnError.ExecuteTargets
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of targets to execute

data.name: OnError.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: UsingTask
data.value: Defines the assembly containing a task's implementation, or contains the implementation itself.

data.name: UsingTask.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the declaration should be evaluated

data.name: UsingTask.AssemblyName
data.value: Optional name of assembly containing the task. Either AssemblyName or AssemblyFile must be used

data.name: UsingTask.AssemblyFile
data.value: Optional path to assembly containing the task. Either AssemblyName or AssemblyFile must be used

data.name: UsingTask.TaskName
data.value: Name of task class in the assembly

data.name: UsingTask.TaskFactory
data.value: Name of the task factory class in the assembly

data.name: UsingTask.Architecture
data.value: Defines the architecture of the task host that this task should be run in. Currently supported values: x86, x64, CurrentArchitecture, and * (any). If Architecture is not specified, either the task will be run within the MSBuild process, or the task host will be launched using the architecture of the parent MSBuild process

data.name: UsingTask.Runtime
data.value: Defines the .NET runtime version of the task host that this task should be run in. Currently supported values: CLR2, CLR4, CurrentRuntime, and * (any). If Runtime is not specified, either the task will be run within the MSBuild process, or the task host will be launched using the runtime of the parent MSBuild process

data.name: ParameterGroup
data.value: Groups parameters that are part of an inline task definition

data.name: Parameter
data.value: Input or output parameter for the task

data.name: Parameter.ParameterType
data.value: Optional string. Type of the task parameter. Defaults to string type.

data.name: Parameter.Output
data.value: Optional bool. Whether this task parameter can be retrieved as an output. Defaults to false.

data.name: Parameter.Required
data.value: Optional bool. Whether this task parameter is required to be passed a value. Defaults to false.

data.name: UsingTaskBody
data.value: Contains the inline task implementation. Content is opaque to MSBuild.

data.name: UsingTaskBody.Evaluate
data.value: Whether the body should have properties expanded before use. Defaults to false.

data.name: Import
data.value: Declares that the contents of another project file should be inserted at this location

data.name: Import.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the import should occur

data.name: Import.Project
data.value: Project file to import

data.name: Import.Label
data.value: Optional expression. Used to identify or order system and user elements

data.name: Import.Sdk
data.value: Name of the SDK which contains the project file to import

data.name: Import.Version
data.value: Optional expression used to specify the version of the SDK referenced by this import

data.name: Import.MinimumVersion
data.value: Optional expression used to specify the minimum SDK version required by the referring import

data.name: Output
data.value: Optional element specifying a specific task output to be gathered

data.name: Output.TaskParameter
data.value: Task parameter to gather. Matches the name of a .NET Property on the task class that has an [Output] attribute

data.name: Output.ItemName
data.value: Optional name of an item list to put the gathered outputs into. Either ItemName or PropertyName must be specified

data.name: Output.PropertyName
data.value: Optional name of a property to put the gathered output into. Either PropertyName or ItemName must be specified

data.name: Output.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the output should be gathered

data.name: Task.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the task should be executed

data.name: Task.ContinueOnError
data.value: Optional boolean indicating whether a recoverable task error should be ignored. Default false

data.name: Task.Architecture
data.value: Defines the bitness of the task if it must be run specifically in a 32bit or 64bit process. If not specified, it will run with the bitness of the build process. If there are multiple tasks defined in UsingTask with the same name but with different Architecture attribute values, the value of the Architecture attribute specified here will be used to match and select the correct task

data.name: Task.Runtime
data.value: Defines the .NET runtime of the task. This must be specified if the task must run on a specific version of the .NET runtime. If not specified, the task will run on the runtime being used by the build process. If there are multiple tasks defined in UsingTask with the same name but with different Runtime attribute values, the value of the Runtime attribute specified here will be used to match and select the correct task

data.name: Task.Parameter
data.value: A paramater to pass to the task

data.name: Metadata.Condition
data.value: Optional expression evaluated to determine whether the metadata should applied to the item

data.name: Metadata
data.value: Arbitrary key-value pairs on the item

data.name: Item
data.value: Creates, updates or removes items and their metadata

data.name: TaskBody
data.value: Data to be passed to the task factory

data.name: Property
data.value: Sets a property value

data.name: ItemDefinition
data.value: The item kind to which to apply metadata
